metadata.title: CVE-2015-6826 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The ff_rv34_decode_init_thread_copy function in libavcodec/rv34.c in FFmpegbefore 2.7.2 does not initialize certain structure members, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid pointer access) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted (1) RV30 or (2) RV40RealVideo data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
